oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Mrs. James K Polk
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Cabinet Card of Sarah Childress Polk. Written on the bottom of the card is "Mrs. James K. Polk, at age 85." Written on the back is "Presented to Mrs. Joseph Horton nee Caroline Polk by Mrs. James K. Polk. March 21 1889"

Sarah Childress Polk (1803-1891) was the wife of 11th President of the United States, James K. Polk (1795-1849). The Shutes and the Polks were related by the marriage of Sally Leah Hilliard to George Washington Polk, who owned Rattle and Snap, a mansion in Maury County. Sally's niece Lavinia Hilliard married William Dickson Shute, owner of Grassmere.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Polk, Sarah Childress, 1803-1891
